Title: Triangle News celebrates Africa’s best
Summary: The Face of Africa Leadership Award was held over the weekend at the University of London, United Kingdom . Triangle News International organised the event . It is the third edition of the Face of African Leadership Award organised by Triangle News .

Title: Shareholders okay VFD’s N13.3 billion dividend, bonus issue
Summary: Shareholders of VFD Group Plc have approved a total dividend payout of N13.27 billion, culminating in N2.50 per share . A five-for-one bonus share issue was also approved .

Title: Beyond Meta vs. Nigeria standoff: Putting people first
Summary: Meta is balking at what it sees as punitive enforcement measures and “unrealistic” regulatory demands . On the other, a sovereign sovereign nation is bowing at what they see as punitive measures . The unfolding dispute between Meta and Nigerian regulators signals a critical inflection point .

Title: LG poll: Protests trail APC primaries over alleged imposition of candidates
Summary: Controversies have erupted within the Lagos State All Progressives Congress (APC) over the just-concluded chairmanship primaries ahead of the June 12 council elections .

Title: Odu’s Investment to hold 43rd AGM on Thursday
Summary: Odu’a Investment Company Limited (OICL) will hold its 43rd yearly general meeting (AGM) on May 15, 2025 . OICL is jointly owned by the governments of the six South West states of Nigeria .

Title: 2027: I’m not going back to Villa, Tinubu ‘wonderful’ president – Patience Jonathan
Summary: Former First Lady, Dame Patience Jonathan has declared she has no intention of returning to Aso Rock . She affirms instead her full support for First Lady Senator Oluremi Tinubu as the nation heads toward 2027 general elections .

Title: Oil marketers flood jetties with 283, 577 metric tonnes of imported petrol, others
Summary: 283, 577 metric tonnes of imported Premium Motor Spirit, PMS, also known as petrol and other petroleum products . This was even as 650,000 Dangote Petroleum Refinery exported 44,000 metric tonne of diesel to global markets . As Dangote Refinery export diesel, import crude, others import crude .

Title: FG defies concerns, ramps up domestic borrowing to N10.85trn
Summary: FG defies concerns, ramps up domestic borrowing to N10.85trn . Shifts borrowing preference to TBs amidst high interest rates . Deficit to escalate as oil revenue underperforms . Analysts disagree over impact of GDP rebasing on debt ratio .

Title: Herders resume attacks on Abavo, kidnap woman, injure 3 vigilante members
Summary: Suspected herdsmen resume attacks on Abavo in Ika South Local Government Area, LGA, of Delta State . They kidnap a female farmer and inflict severe bullet injuries on three members of the community’s vigilante team . The injured victims, it was gathered, were part of a vigilante group established to provide security for Ab

Title: Tinubu bags lifetime African achievement award in Ghana
Summary: The President received the award as special guest of honour during the 25th anniversary of the Millennium Excellence Prize in Kumasi, Ghana . Tinubu, while receiving the award, commended the patron of the Foundation, Otumfuo Osei Tutu II, Asantehene, for the invitation extended to him and the success of

Title: South-South farmers decry lack of govt support
Summary: Some city returnees who are currently undertaking rainy season farming in the South-South region have decried lack of support from the government . The farmers made the expression while responding to a News Agency of Nigeria survey on the challenges being faced by wet season farmers in the region . NAN observes that some unskilled workers residing in the cities are

Title: JUST IN: ASUU elects new president
Summary: The Academic Staff Union of Universities has elected a consultant psychiatrist at the University of Jos Teaching Hospital, Prof. Chris Piwuna, as its next president . The decision was taken at the 23rd National Delegates Congress of the Union, which took place in Benin on Sunday .

Title: Dangote tackles marketers, insists on capacity to meet fuel demand
Summary: The Dangote Refinery has refuted claims by oil marketers that the facility does not have the capacity to meet local fuel demand . Officials of the refinery told our correspondent that the refinery has enough fuel to satisfy local needs and export to other countries . The Depot and Petroleum Products Marketers Association of Nigeria said marketers only want to keep their businesses

Title: Anti-corruption efforts should shift to prevention – Ribadu
Summary: National Security Adviser to President Bola Tinubu, Mallam Nuhu Ribadu, has called for a paradigm shift in Nigeria’s anti-corruption efforts from reactive crackdowns to proactive prevention . He made the call on Saturday while delivering the 9th Oba Sikiru Adetona Annual Professorial Lecture
